meanings.definition: To feel regret or remorse for; lament; mourn.
meanings.sent1: After breaking the vase, she was ruing her carelessness.
meanings.sent2: He was ruing the missed opportunity to visit his grandparents.
meanings.sent3: While ruing his mistake, he accidentally spilled his drink.
meanings.sent4: She was ruing the lost chances like a sailor rues a storm at sea.
meanings.sent5: The image of the shattered mirror kept ruing in her mind.

meanings.definition: To feel sorrow or regret for; wish undone.
meanings.sent1: Ruing his decision, he wished he had chosen differently.
meanings.sent2: She was ruing the harsh words she had spoken in anger.
meanings.sent3: While ruing his actions, he tripped over a rock.
meanings.sent4: The old man was ruing the passage of time like a river rues its banks.
meanings.sent5: The missed opportunity kept ruing in his thoughts, haunting him.
